CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 25, 1954, pg. 12, reads: "Fifth Avenue Red Cross Party for Davis Home - Members of the Red Cross Council at Fifth Avenue High School, shown standing against the wall on the far left, held a Christmas party for youngsters of the Davis Home for Children on Simonton Street last Saturday. The pupils earned the money for the party by holding a dance at the high school.  Other project conducted by the Fifth Avenue Red Cross Council include reading to children in hospitals, painting Christmas scenes on windows in Children's Ward at Passavant Hospital, assisting the Gray Ladies and nurses at Passavant Hospital, collecting comic books for the hospitals, making favors for trays of patients in hospitals and the staging of a Halloween party at the Ward Home.  In the photo above, the Fifth Avenue pupils are watching Davis Home youngsters play a game of 'musical chairs.'  Standing are Russell Lane, James Webster, George Dorsey, David Reed, president of the Fifth Avenue Red Cross Council; Mrs. Elizabeth Walker, sponsor; Kenneth Holliday and Alfred Dorsey.  In the center are Darryl Dorsey, Bettie Lane and Edith Lane.  Seated are Darlene Dorsey, Alice James, Rosalie Travis, Mary Lou Parker, Lee Grace Jones, Alice Platt, Verdine Station, Dorothy Shackleford and Rose Marie Shelton. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women and men watching children play musical chairs, including Russell Lane, James Webster, George Dorsey, David Reed, Elizabeth Walker, Kenneth Holliday, Alfred Dorsey, Darryl Dorsey, Bettie Lane, Edith Lane, Darlene Dorsey, Alice James, Rosalie Travis, Mary Lou Parker, Lee Grace Jones, Alice Platt, Verdine Station, Dorothy Shackleford, and Rose Marie Shelton, in Davis Home
